com.anotherservice.rest.core

Class ServiceMonitor

  • Object
    • Thread
      • ServiceMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class ServiceMonitor
extends Thread
    This class is the base loader for REST services. It watchs over the specified services directory for changes. If a service folder is created, the ServiceMonitor initializes it in a new isolated Context. If a service folder is removed, the ServiceMonitor tries to unload all Handlers and to free the Context.


    Initializing a service follows these steps :

    1. Browse the service directory specified by setDirectory(String)
    2. Find the XML service configuration file specified by setConfigFileName(String)
    3. Read the value of the initializer XML tag specified by setInitializerSection(String)
    4. Load all jar files in the service directory in a common JarLoader context
    5. Create a new instance of the Initializer specified in step 3 in the context created at step 4
    6. Call the initialize() method against it

    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele
    See Also:
    Handler, JarLoader, Initializer
    Note:
    Unloading a Initializer context highly depends on garbage collection and existing references. Thus, even though visible references are removed, some may remain. Hence, if over-expoiting this mechanism, the memory usage may suffer from this.
